summary.para: Gets the bits per pixel (BPP) of the pixel format.

param.name: puiBitsPerPixel
param.para: Pointer that receives the BPP of the pixel format.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the number of channels the pixel format contains.

param.name: puiChannelCount
param.para: Pointer that receives the channel count.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the pixel format's channel mask.

param.name: uiChannelIndex
param.para: The index to the channel mask to retrieve.

param.name: cbMaskBuffer
param.para: The size of the pbMaskBuffer buffer.

param.name: pcbActual
param.para: The actual buffer size needed to obtain the channel mask.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If 0 and NULL are passed in for cbMaskBuffer and pbMaskBuffer, respectively, the required buffer size will be returned through pcbActual.

param.name: ppIColorContext
param.para: Pointer that receives the pixel format's color context.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The returned color context is the default color space for the pixel format. However, if an IWICBitmapSource specifies its own color context, the source's context should be preferred over the pixel format's default.

param.name: pFormat
param.para: Pointer that receives the pixel format GUID.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods that provide information about a pixel format.
